Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a bald or shaven young man, broken from a figure, probably a priest; with a fold of flesh at the back of the neck. Solid, from two-piece mould. Possibly red slip traces at back and on temples. Brown Nile silt with frequent fine gold mica, quartz, black and rare white inclusions.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Similar examples have been dated to the last quarter of third century BC and the beginning of first century BC (Fischer 1994; no. 423 and no. 429),first half of first century BC (Schürmann 1989; no. 1218) and second century BC from Edfu (Szymańska 1999C; 80, fig. 1). Close parallel from Hogarth's excavations in Naukratis (Gutch in Hogarth 1899, pl.XIII, no.210). Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen: Wasmuth. Schürmann, W. 1989. Katalog der antiken Terrakotten im Badischen Landesmuseum Karlsruhe. Göteberg. Szymańska, H. 1999. In N.Grimal (ed.) Tell-Edfou, soixante and après. Cairo.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3578)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.515) (Phase 1)
